name: Measles Condition
timebox_description: Do not submit for same individual more than 1x every 180 days.

clinical.name: Measles (Disorders) (SNOMED)
clinical.description: SNOMED codes for Measles as a diagnosis or active problem

clinical.name: Measles (Disorders) (ICD10CM)
clinical.description: ICD-10-CM codes for Measles as a diagnosis or active problem

clinical.name: Measles (Koplik Spots) (Disorders) (SNOMED)
clinical.description: Measles-specific clinical observations like Koplik spots

laboratory.name: Measles (Tests for measles virus by Culture and Identification Method)
laboratory.description: Tests for identifying Measles virus by culture

laboratory.name: Measles (Tests for measles virus Nucleic Acid)
Measles (Tests for measles virus IgM Antibody)
Measles (Tests for measles virus IgG Antibody [Ratio] in Serum)
laboratory.description: IgG ratio tests (acute vs. convalescent serum)

laboratory.name: Measles (Test Panels for measles virus Nucleic Acid)
laboratory.description: Multi-test panels for Measles nucleic acid

laboratory.name: Measles (Test Panels for measles virus IgM Antibody)
laboratory.description: Multi-test panels for IgM antibodies to Measles

laboratory.name: Measles (Organism or Substance in Lab Results)
laboratory.description: SNOMED codes indicating lab-detected Measles organisms

epidemiologic.name: Exposure to Measles (SNOMED)
epidemiologic.description: SNOMED codes for confirmed exposure to Measles

epidemiologic.name: Increased Risk for Exposure to Measles (SNOMED)
epidemiologic.description: SNOMED codes indicating increased risk of exposure

clinical_context.name: Measles (History of Disease) (SNOMED)
clinical_context.description: SNOMED codes indicating a patient’s past history of Measles

clinical_context.name: Measles (Vaccine Administered) (CVX)
clinical_context.description: CVX codes for Measles-containing vaccines administered

clinical_context.name: Measles (Vaccine Administered) (SNOMED)
clinical_context.description: SNOMED codes for Measles vaccine products given

clinical_context.name: Measles (Vaccination Procedure) (SNOMED)
clinical_context.description: SNOMED codes for procedures related to Measles vaccination

clinical_context.name: Measles (Adverse Reactions) (SNOMED)
clinical_context.description: Adverse reactions related to Measles vaccination or infection

lab_context.name: Measles (Tests for measles virus IgG Antibody [Presence])
lab_context.description: IgG presence tests used to determine immunity, not for case confirmation

lab_context.name: Measles (Test Panels for measles virus IgG Antibody)
lab_context.description: Panels for IgG antibodies, often used for immunity screening

lab_context.name: Measles (Tests for measles virus Ab [Presence])
lab_context.description: Tests checking general antibody presence, not case-defining

lab_context.name: Measles (Test Panels for measles virus Ab)
lab_context.description: General panels for measles antibodies (IgG/IgM), not specific

epidemiologic_context.name: Travel or Residence in Country with Endemic Measles (SNOMED)
epidemiologic_context.description: Travel or residence in countries where Measles is endemic

epidemiologic_context.name: Travel or Residence in U.S. State with Endemic Measles (SNOMED)
epidemiologic_context.description: Travel or residence in U.S. states/territories with endemic Measles

cste_position_statement_logic.description: CLINICAL|Measles (as a diagnosis or active problem)*
CLINICAL|Suspected Measles (as a diagnosis or active problem)*
CLINICAL|Koplik spots (for Measles)*
CLINICAL|Rash (any)
CLINICAL|Fever (temperature ≥ 38°C [≥ 100.4°F])
LABORATORY|Identification of Measles virus in a clinical specimen by culture method, including identification tests performed on an isolate - include preliminary results
LABORATORY|Detection of Measles virus nucleic acid in a clinical specimen by any method
LABORATORY|Detection of Measles virus antigen in a clinical specimen by any method
LABORATORY|Detection of Measles virus IgM antibody in a clinical specimen by any method

LABORATORY|Detection of 4-fold or greater increase in Measles virus IgG antibody titer between paired acute and convalescent serum specimens (collected at least 10 days but no more than 180 days apart) by any method
LABORATORY|Lab test ordered for identification of Measles virus in a clinical specimen by culture method, including identification tests performed on an isolate
LABORATORY|Lab test ordered for detection of Measles virus nucleic acid in a clinical specimen by any method
LABORATORY|Lab test ordered for detection of Measles virus antigen in a clinical specimen by any method
LABORATORY|Lab test ordered for detection of Measles virus IgM antibody in a clinical specimen by any method
EPIDEMIOLOGIC|Exposure to Measles
EPIDEMIOLOGIC|Increased risk for exposure to Measles
EPIDEMIOLOGIC|Patient has or had contact with a person diagnosed with Measles
EPIDEMIOLOGIC|Patient is a member of a risk group as defined by public health authorities during an outbreak of Measles
EPIDEMIOLOGIC|Patient resides in a geographic area where Measles is endemic or an outbreak of Measles is occurring
EPIDEMIOLOGIC|Patient travelled during past 21 days to a geographic area where Measles is endemic or an outbreak of Measles is occurring
